channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Pubs busy as most rules end in Wales
item.description: Social distancing ends, but face masks are still needed in shops and on public transport.

item.title: Bridge-collapse fears trigger alert for Bassaleg homeowners
item.description: Temporary accommodation is available for those who decide to leave, the council says.

item.title: Covid: Students in Wales able to enjoy first night out in 18 months
item.description: Nightclubs in Wales are finally able to reopen their doors - but people are urged to be sensible.

item.title: South Africa 19-16 British and Irish Lions: Morne Steyn's late penalty wins series
item.description: The British and Irish Lions lose an agonisingly close series decider to South Africa as Morne Steyn's late penalty seals a 19-16 victory.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Balloons tribute to boy found dead in river
item.description: About 200 people gathered to release balloons and pay tribute to five-year-old Logan.

item.title: Covid: How will we adjust to life without so many rules?
item.description: With Wales moving into alert level zero, an expert says behaviours learnt in the pandemic might last.

item.title: Cardiff Gate hotel car park 'stabbing' prompts arrest
item.description: A 23-year-old is arrested following the incident in a car park at the Ibis hotel, Cardiff Gate.

item.title: Family tribute to 'blue-eyed boy' killed on Carmarthenshire farm
item.description: Police say three-year-old Ianto Sior Jenkins died after he was hit by a vehicle on the farm.

item.title: Thunderstorm weather warning for Wales on Sunday
item.description: Heavy rain could cause some flooding and travel disruption on Sunday, the Met Office says.

item.title: Llanelli: Man, 56, dies after falling from e-scooter
item.description: No other vehicles were involved and the man died at the scene, police say.

item.title: Charge delays slammed as St Asaph man's body 'deteriorates'
item.description: A coroner is concerned prosecutors' "tardiness" means a man's body remains in a mortuary.

item.title: Covid: Excitement as nightclubs reopen in Wales
item.description: Most of Wales' remaining Covid rules are lifted as nightclubs reopen in alert level zero.

item.title: Covid: Hospitality rules change after '18 months of hell'
item.description: Two-metre distancing and masks will not be legally required in pubs and restaurants from Saturday.

item.title: Covid: Live music in Wales resumes with Feeder gig
item.description: Despite outdoor restrictions being relaxed weeks ago, the venue is still taking precautions.

item.title: Covid: First minister outlines end of most restrictions
item.description: Wales is "on the final lap of emerging from the pandemic", Mark Drakeford says.

item.title: Covid lockdown easing: What are people looking forward to in Wales?
item.description: As most restrictions end in Wales on Saturday, weddings, events and socialising are back.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Price 'over the moon' to reach gold-medal fight
item.description: Great Britain boxer Lauren Price says she is "over the moon" to reach Sunday's middleweight final.

item.title: Blackburn Rovers 2-1 Swansea City: New Swans boss Russell Martin loses first game
item.description: Swansea City lose their first match under new head coach Russell Martin, their Championship opener at Blackburn Rovers.

item.title: Cardiff City 1-1 Barnsley: Toby Sibbick earns point for Tykes after Marlon Pack strike
item.description: Cardiff City and Barnsley share the spoils in an entertaining season opening 1-1 draw in the Welsh capital.

item.title: Oldham Athletic 0-1 Newport County: Kevin Ellison nets late Exiles winner
item.description: Kevin Ellison's 88th-minute goal sees Newport County claim an opening-day victory at Oldham Athletic.

item.title: Julian Winter: Swansea City chief promises more investment from American owners
item.description: Swansea City chief executive Julian Winter says the club's American owners will invest more into the Championship club this year.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Golds for GB pentathlete Joe Choong & boxer Galal Yafai, cycling silver, Tom Daley and Josh Kerr bronzes
item.description: Pentathlete Joe Choong wins Great Britain's 20th gold medal of the Tokyo Games after boxer Galal Yafai became an Olympic flyweight champion on Saturday.

item.title: Llacio cyfyngiadau wrth i Gymru symud i lefel sero
item.description: Y rhan fwyaf o gyfyngiadau bellach wedi'u llacio wrth i Gymru symud i lefel rhybudd sero.

item.title: Teyrnged cymuned i fachgen pump oed fu farw mewn afon
item.description: Tua 200 o bobl wedi ymgynnull i roi teyrnged i Logan Mwangi a gafodd ei ddarganfod yn farw yn Afon Ogwr.

item.title: Dyn yn yr ysbyty ar ôl 'trywaniad' mewn maes parcio
item.description: Mae dyn 23 oed wedi cael ei arestio'n dilyn y digwyddiad ym maes parcio gwesty'r Ibis, yng Ngiât Caerdydd.

item.title: Llyfr y Flwyddyn: 'Iechyd meddwl yn epidemig ymysg pobl ifanc'
item.description: Awdur y nofel fuddugol ym mhrif wobr Llyfr y Flwyddyn eleni yn disgrifio mai ei bwriad oedd ceisio 'gwneud i rai pobl ifanc deimlo'n llai unig'.

item.title: Adran Dau: Oldham 0-1 Casnewydd
item.description: Casnewydd oedd yn fuddugol gyda Kevin Ellison yn penio'r bel mewn i'r gôl 88 munud mewn i'r gêm.
